title: Hebrew text is drawn reversed
body:
Hi,

I want to use skiasharp to write hebrew text on an image, but hebrew text is drawn reversed.
Can you take care of it?

Thanks!

comments.author: Chasyl
comments.body: I'm using version 1.60.0 and I don't see this function.

comments.author: Gillibald
comments.body: You need to use the SkiaSharp.HarfBuzz package https://www.nuget.org/packages/SkiaSharp.HarfBuzz/

comments.author: Chasyl
comments.body:
Hi,
can I write mixed text (English and hebrew together)?
I tried doing it and the english text becomes rectangles.

comments.author: Gillibald
comments.body: You have to split your text into runs with a unique direction. So you have to draw Hebrew and English text separately. Also consider using the font mager for character matching to find a suitable Typeface.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: @Gillibald at some point we are going to have to get icu or some similar library bound.

comments.author: Gillibald
comments.body: I think we can bundle SkiaSharp.HarfBuzz with a text segmenter that is producing a text blob of unique runs. For more advanced scenarios we need a markup for styled text.
